tafseer.tafsir: Allah insinuates the inhabitants of hell by saying, "Have you received news about the Day of Judgment?"

Then Allah explained that humans at that time were divided into two, namely the group of unbelievers and the group of believers. When the disbelievers saw the awesomeness that happened at that time, they bowed their heads and felt humiliated. Allah said: And (what a horror), if you saw those who sinned bowed their heads before their Lord, (they said), "O our Lord, we have seen and heard, then return us (to the world), surely we will do good. Truly, we are people of faith." (as-Sajdah/32: 12) And the word of Allah: And you will see them being brought down to hell in a downcast state because (feeling) contempt, they see with a languid look. And those who believe say, "Indeed, the losers are those who will harm themselves and their families on the Day of Resurrection." Remember, in fact the wrongdoers are in eternal punishment. (asy-Shura/42: 45)

Allah explains that those who disbelieve while living in the world work diligently and earnestly. However, their actions are not accepted because they do not believe in Allah and His Messenger, which is the main condition for accepting their actions and receiving His rewards.

In these verses, Allah explains that disbelievers will be put into hell. If they ask for water because they are thirsty, they are given water from a very hot spring. When they ask for food, they are given bad food, which has no meaning. Allah says: And there is no food (for him) except blood and pus. (al-haqqah/69: 36) And the word of Allah: Then verily you, O you who go astray, deny! will definitely eat the zaqqum tree. (al-Waqi'ah/56: 51-52) In another verse Allah says: Truly the tree of zaqqum, food for people who sin a lot. (ad-Dukhan/44: 43-44)

Allah explains that in heaven, the faces of the believers will be radiant with joy. They feel happy to see the results of their efforts that get the pleasure of Allah who then get the coveted paradise reward. (10-16) In the following verses, Allah describes the state of heaven: 1. Heaven is a place of high value, higher than the value of other places. 2. In it no useless words are heard, because that place is the place of those who are loved by God. 3. Inside there is a spring that flows clean water that attracts the eyes of anyone who sees it. 4. Inside there is a high mahligai. 5. Near them are glasses filled with ready-to-drink drinks. 6. Inside there are arranged pillows that can be used according to their taste, sitting on them or used to lean on and so on. 7. There are also beautiful rugs spread out in every place. 8. There are all kinds of spiritual and physical pleasures that are far from what we can imagine.

In these verses, Allah asks whether they did not pay attention to how the camel, which was in front of their eyes and used all the time, was created. How is the sky that is in a high place without pillars; how the mountains are firmly fixed, not shaken and made a guide for those who are on a journey. On it there are lakes and springs that can be used for human needs, watering plants, and giving water to livestock. How is the earth spread out as a place to live for humans. If they had paid close attention to all of this, they would have admitted that their Creator could revive humans on the Day of Judgment.

In this verse, Allah commands the Prophet Muhammad to give warnings and instructions and convey His religion to mankind, because his job is nothing but to warn by conveying good news and scary news.

In these verses, Allah explains that the Prophet Muhammad did not have the power to make someone believe. However, it is Allah who has the power to make people believe. Meanwhile, whoever turns away by denying the truth of His Prophet's instructions, Allah will surely punish him. Allah said: And if your Lord had willed, everyone on earth would have believed entirely. But do you (want to) force people so that they become believers? (Yunus/10: 99) And Allah said: We know better about what they say, and you (Muhammad) are not coercive against them. So give a warning with the Qur'an to anyone who fears My threat. (Qaf/50: 45) In this regard, it is enough for preachers to convey the messages of the Al-Qur'an and the hadiths of the Prophet while inviting every human being to believe and do good deeds, and enter into the religion of Islam as a whole (kaffah). Appearance and methods of preaching need to be in a good way and should not be coercive, as Allah says: There is no compulsion in (adhering to) religion (Islam), in fact there is a clear (difference) between the right way and the wrong way. (al-Baqarah/2: 256) And Allah said: Call (people) to the way of your Lord with wisdom and good teaching, and argue with them in a good way. Surely your Lord, He is the one who knows best who has strayed from His way and He knows best who is guided. (an-Nahl/16: 125)

In these verses, Allah makes it clear that they will return to Him. There was no way for them to run from Him. He is the one who will judge them for the deeds they have done in the world and then pass down His punishment. These verses were a consolation to the Prophet Muhammad and a remedy for his sorrow and pain at the disbelief of the disbelievers.
